intro: Phlogacanthus pochinii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces yellow flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for both aesthetic and practical purposes.
